definitions.definition: The percentage or amount by which a seller hikes up his buy-in price when determining his selling price.
examples: You don’t make much money selling gas because the markup is so low.
There will be a markup on those products next week; better buy them now.

definitions.definition: The notation that is used to indicate the meaning of the elements in an electronic document , or to dictate how text should be displayed .
The process by which proposed legislation is debated and amended .

main_definition: The percentage or amount by which a seller hikes up his buy-in price when determining his selling price.
secondary_definitions: ( computing ) The notation that is used to indicate the meaning of the elements in an electronic document , or to dictate how text should be displayed .
( US politics ) The process by which proposed legislation is debated and amended .
